rComments: Prof. Perez does not seem to enjoy teaching. She was often rude and expected all students to know everything. Very difficult and seemed bothered when students would ask her questions. If you can, avoid her unless you want your semester to be ruined.
The prof really expected you to know everything before class.

Prof Perez-Leroux was fantastic--her lectures are well-organized, valuable, and involving, and she provides notes. In-class practicals were exciting and a fun way to learn. The research essay was a great opportunity. Most of all, she is a wonderful person,genuinely cares about students and teaching, and is always happy to help--in OH's/after class.

She holds a lot of contempt for students who do not have a more than basic understanding of advanced grammar. Thinks very highly of herself and never misses a chance to show off and / or talk about her credentials and professional experiences in the field of Spanish. Very high maintenance, extremely high expectations of everyone. Perfectionist.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: She is very strict with the content and marks specially on the way teaching the material is very confusing

This woman is an absolute nightmare to deal with. As director of a department, she has very little knowledge about the program and streams. It seemed that any warranted inquiry was a bother to her, she was very rude, and abruptly ended all communication. She harshly reiterated her position as a professor, and did not feel such was acknowledged.
Shes cool
covering way too much material for a half year course, expect to write difficult short&long answer exams.

Do yourself a favour and AVOID this professor. Her tests cover way too much material that you won't prepared for, lecture notes are disorganized and confusing, and lectures themselves are not helpful at all. She doesn't know how to teach and made me hate the subject altogether.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Worst Professor I have ever encountered at Uoft. I would NEVER take a course with this professor ever again. She was very mean and highly disorganized. Her lectures made no sense and she would get easily angered when someone didn't understand. She is very unhelpful and condescending. Honestly the worst Professor I have encountered by far. Stay away
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: The course was very boring as the professor jumped all over the place and often showed movies for the last half of class. The class was pretty easy though with self study you can do well in the course without attending class.

Incapable of asking a question clearly in class and on assignments/tests. Responses to questions posed by students are indirect and unclear. Loses student materials. Disorganized. Slides full of typos and grammatical errors. Adds additional assignments midway through the course. Course content/textbook is fascinating - wait for a different prof.
I didn't feel like I learned very much. A bell curve of 30% just shows she doesn't know how to write tests. Ridiculously hard tests and assignments, lazy teaching style. AVOID.

She's a good prof, at first her lectures might seem confusing but as long as you have a supportive material youÂ´ll be fine, she expands your horizons and understanding of the subject. Besides she's so educated and has a lot of experience, really helpful, even though not an easy prof you have to work hard to achieve your grade I got an A .
Mid-term was so unclear and difficult, it had to be curved 30%. Assignment instructions were unclear and assumed prerequisite knowledge which was never taught. Boring, incomprehensible. Avoid
Frustrating, unclear, no use of textbook, lectures and handouts are vague and generally irrelevant. She's made me hate my favourite subject.
Assignments are extremely vague and frustrating. No textbook, either you write down what she says or you have zero information.

Professor Perez Leroux is also the undergrad spanish chair - she helped me with a grade change this year and was so understanding and helpful.  I heard results within two weeks and the process was much less painful than I ever thought it could be.  She is to be commended for her efficient work.

Midterm was too difficult.  Covered way too much information: everything from articles, textbook, and lecture slides.  Had to be belcurved 20%.  She really respects students' opinions though and listens to students.

Avoid this woman at all costs. She is boring, incomprehensible and runs over time despite having 3 hour lectures. Her assignments are vague and asking her questions will just confuse you even more. She is condescending and  the class average for our last test was so low it had to be bell curved 20%. AVOID.

This course was very well organized, with full lecture notes posted online, as well as a bulletin board to ask questions, and other helpful links. The lectures were generally very interesting, but the expectations for the assignments seemed unclear to me. Overall, she's very good!
Incomprehensible, slow, boring, AND unclear and difficult midterm/exam. Horrible experience.
Found her to be very patronizing, unclear, with ridiculous tests/exams

Her multiple choice questions had more than one answer being correct. Assignments were vague and confusing. Marking is unfair. ALWAYS runs out of time and wastes alot of time. BUT, if you go to her for extra help, she'll clarify a lot, she's very nice, good power points. She's interesting and classes aren't too boring.

perez-leroux in one word: hard-line! tests too complicated+long for the time given to complete. lecs were waste of time - no ques. asked/answered adequately, esp since class had 30+ students & was only 50 min long, all made worse b/c she's NOT approachable - get ANYBODY else if u get this prof!
frustratingly unclear and unreliable

I've no idea what she's talking about. Pointless group participation. Her tests, especially the midterm were vague.  For her 8 alternatives MC questions, she added in pointless distrators to try to fool us.  Needless to say I got fooled by her =)
Absolutely horrible! Disorganized, unclear, not helpful... you can't get worse!
Lectures were disorganized and unclear.  A lot of time was wasted on taking class surveys (e.g. finding out what languages everyone speaks). Learned some interesting random facts though.

Her lectures leave me confused and frustrated. She asks a big class to participate in pointless discussion. Her tests are painfully unclear. Good thing the textbook puts the ideas together in a managable way. Needs to be more organized and clearer.
No Comments
Even a yr. later, this course was the most disorganized I've taken- ever
No Comments
Has the potential to be great.
Enthusiastic but lecture notes were disorganized. Got lost in the course!
